		Question: what government did the roman empire have
		Answer:
answer: The Roman Empire had a representative republic, in which the Senate was the highest governmental body. The Senate was made up of senators,  who represented the various provinces of the empire. The Senate was responsible for passed legislation and for overseeing the empire. The Senate also acted as a court, trying cases involving rebellious governments and punishing traitors. The praetorian prefect, who was appointed by the Senate, was the supreme leader of the Roman army.
